meanings.definition: Cook (food) partially or completely before finishing it off or reheating it.
meanings.sent1: I always precook the pasta before adding the sauce.
meanings.sent2: She precooked the chicken before grilling it for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to precook the vegetables to save time later.
meanings.sent4: Precooking the meat is like laying the foundation for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent5: Remember to precook the rice for perfect stir-fry every time.

meanings.definition: The act of partially or completely cooking food before finishing it off or reheating it.
meanings.sent1: Precooking is a common practice in professional kitchens.
meanings.sent2: The precooking of the ingredients made the final dish come together quickly.
meanings.sent3: The party host's secret weapon was precooking all the appetizers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of meal prep, precooking is a game-changer.
meanings.sent5: The cookbook emphasized the importance of precooking for busy families.
